reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read reviews about renovations and building works we were a bit concerned before going but with no need to be. The hotel was great, the room (go for King rather than Queen as the room size is that little bit more generous) immaculate and everything felt new and luxurious. The beds are very comfortable with a soft mattress cover allowing you to melt into the bed. The bathroom, though not particularly large, was spotless, and well-designed, and once we requested bathrobes and slippers we were all set for the weekend. Location was fantastic, less than 5 mins from the Central Stations and a stone's throw from good restaurants, cafes and other entertainment. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Combine that with a great offer we had on the price, and we were literally laughing.
reviews.title: First class hotel, brand new rooms, ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights at this hotel last weekend. Reception staff and concierge extremely friendly and helpful. Was a bit worried as I had read some other reviews which were not great but only fault I had with the room was it was too warm even with the air conditioning on. Room was spotlessly clean, lovely bathroom, great shower. Beds are absolutely divine, so comfy. Only regret was we had not booked breakfast and didn't find anywhere that great nearby. Next time I would have breakfast included as it looked lovely. Location is great for Central Station. Within walking distance of Dam Sq and Red Light district too. Tram to Van Gogh museum though as too far.
reviews.title: Lovely room, excellent shower and fantastic comfy bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Also try the tapas restuarant around the corner from the hotel called Joselito's, excellent atmosphere, great for people watching and food good.Turn right out of hotel and then right again.
reviews.title: Unrecognisable..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I hadn't stayed here for a while. Last time I was in town, the place was being refurbished. Paid €149 per night which by Amsterdam standards is pretty cheap. The renovations are complete - and happily the only thing which is the same is the standard of service, which is excellent.
reviews.title: divine bedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in room 644. I don't know if that was an upgrade or not, but if it wasn't, it was an exceptional room. The whole hotel is non-smoking now (like all Dutch hotels I think) so the "exotic herbal" smells which used to permeate the place are a thing of the past.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I echo Zippylondon's review. This hotel is in a great location for "doing" central Amsterdam. The room was very comfortable and those are the good points. We, too, experienced queuing at check-in and check-out. Only 2 out of 3 lifts were working which meant occasional lengthy waits. Public areas were frequently not clean. Breakfast is an (expensive - €25) disaster area with rude staff and at 9 00am on a Saturday a sea of uncleared tables. Other staff were pleasant - but this shouldn't be a lottery. The general impression was of an understaffed hotel badly managed.
reviews.title: 5 Star it ain't

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this is nowhere near a 5* hotel. If you must stay here don't take breakfast in the hotel there are plenty of canalside cafes within a 5 minute stroll offering better for half the price.
reviews.title: Great location, couldn't care less service...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009
reviews.text: This hotel is in an unbeatable location; a few minutes walk from Centraal Station and spitting distance from a whole host of 'must see' locations.
reviews.title: Great location, crap service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We turned up at the hotel early on a Friday afternoon and were greeted by a sight of absolute armageddon (or my imagination of what armageddon would like like anyway). There were hoards of (grumpy) customers checking in and out - the queue (or 'line' for American readers) was out of the door. Literally. We were told in no uncertain terms that we'd have a serious wait - they'd been busy after all.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel with great service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned after 3pm and were told that our rooms were still not ready - this was despite us being told earlier that 3pm was check in time. By this time, a couple of flights from USA and Canada had offloaded their cargo and sleeping (would be) guests were littering the reception, bar and any other area with a soft seat.
reviews.title: Nice, but I probably expected more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed in Renaissance for one night in August, while we stayed in many hotels in Amsterdam before, this one was average for what it is. big hotel, like any other hotels you find everywhere. nothing special about it and the service is not so great, especially that service usually in hotels in Amsterdam are amazing.
reviews.title: Average by all means

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Stayed here on business for a couple of nights. Check in process was far too slow, waited over 10 minutes to be checked in and there was only one person in the queue on front of me. Room was small but clean and comfortable. Surprised a 5 star hotel thinks shower curtains are ok, mini bar did not appear to be fully stocked. Did the job!
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were treated to a wonderful stay for five nights at this wonderful hotel. He loved the lush bedding and the size of the room. I loved the location, attentive staff (great turn down service) and high end bath products. Having Marriott status, we were able to enjoy the club lounge after long days of touring. I will certainly recommend this hotel to my friends and family who travel to Amsterdam and desire a comfortable stay.
reviews.title: first class treatment
Lovely stay for 1 night
reviews.text: Spent 1 night here last weekend and was more than happy with this hotel, great location, we walked everywhere from here... bed was wonderful and super king, like sleeping on a cloud..did not have breakfast but I note the american breakfast was €27 each, slightly cheaper for continental... the room does have a fridge but it is one of the 'memory' ones so if you move a bottle you are charged so therefore you cannot store your own water inside... was not provided with dressing gown or slippers as stated in the hotel description... the room does have tea/coffee facilities however no milk, just cream.... the coffee machine downstairs is a nice touch but only available until 12 noon.... had a fabulous meal at a mexican just around the corner from this hotel.. we arrived at 10.30am in the morning and our room was ready for us which was a nice surprise.... would highly recommend a stay here and will certainly return at some point.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a beautiful, modern, contemporary style hotel in the middle of a quaint neighborhood. The hotel is clean and modern, and has a great location. You're close to the Central station. We walked easily to all sights in Amsterdam. If you have Marriott status, you'll enjoy the nicely stocked club lounge.
reviews.title: Nice modern, contemporary hotel in quaint neighborhood.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I've stayed in this hotel many times. There's always a warm welcome, the rooms are always clean and of a high standard. I also like the location, near to the hustle and bustle but in a nice quiet street. It's also close to the railway station making for a stress free arrival. There is a little burger bar which does excellent lunches, and the main restaurant is great fir evening meals. I am biased, but that's because I've never had a bad experience.
reviews.title: Consistently warm welcome, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Excellent location in a quiet street very near to Centraal Station. I stayed one night and this was a perfect location. Clean modern rooms, close to main attractions and transport. Felt very safe and would definately choose this hotel for a return visit. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great location, clean comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel is a very short walk to Central station and many other attractions in Amsterdam city. The hotel is clean and the rooms are adequately sized or European standards. I just wish the front desk staff had put in a little more effort into making may stay more comfortable when they couldn't accommodate my early check-in request. They don't have free wifi and three hours into my wait for my room I found out there was free coffee and a complimentary wifi card they could have offered me. Most of the time when hotels realize you've been on a long flight (10 hrs plus in my case) they try to accommodate your request for an early check in or provide you with some little comforts while you wait. Even when I asked the front desk person where to wait she gave my this blank look before pointing to the main. Again, I later found out there was a more private part I could have waited.
reviews.title: Ok hotel with convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I just want the hotel to know that there's more to the hotel industry than clean rooms, customers, especially new ones have to feel welcome and well cared for. They were polite but missed the boat on being hospitable. I have not decided yet if I'll be going back or not.
reviews.title: Even better our second stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here last Spring and based on that good experience, we chose it again for a week long visit here with family during September. We liked the location close to Centraal Station and were so satisfied with the hotel that when we found ourselves able to extend our vacation, we chose to stay here two more days. Our room was in the section called the Annex, which called for a bit of a walk from the elevator but we were very happy with it. We were away from the street noise and the room was large, comfortable and well equipped. The staff was friendly and helpful with everything from tram tickets, directions to sights and suggestions for shopping, to just plain visiting with us when time allowed. We were able to use the Club lounge and found the staff there to be just as helpful and friendly. We plan future trips to Amsterdam for those family visits and will always hope that there will be a room available at the Renaissance for us. Thank you for a wonderful stay!
reviews.title: Very Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights just last week. The weather was awesome for two full days we were able to enjoy the city. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful, especially the concierge who were very eager to help and made great recommendations for things to do and dinner.
reviews.title: Staff was so nice, especially the concierge.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The executive lounge/club lounge was quite nice. The restaurant served a wonderful breakfast buffet which we enjoyed one day.
reviews.title: Worst service out of any Marriott property...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is just a 5 minute walk from Central station.
reviews.title: Central, modern, spacious Renaissance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was newly renovated however our room was a bit on the small side, not tiny but not huge either, just a small standard hotel room.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rented scooters/vespas for two days from HOTEL SCOOTERS and it was awesome. Everyone has a bicycle or a scooter so it's neat to travel around the city the same way the locals do.
reviews.title: nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the outside the hotel does look very 1960s, however inside the newly renovated hotel was immaculate. King sized bed, LCD TV and lovely soft pillows. The service at the hotel was excellent. We arrived in Amsterdam at 10.00 am but check in was not until 3.00 pm, however we headed off to the hotel (which is only a 5 min walk from the station) where we were told there was a room ready…great! we were able to drop off our bags!! The hotel is right in the centre, however beautifully quite, so everything seems to be in walking distance, but the noise of the weekend crowds is kept to a minimum. The breakfast is very pricy at the hotel, however walk out of the hotel and there are some great little restaurants around. Next time we are in Amsterdam I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel in a fabulous city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have been coming to Amsterdam since the late nineties. Have tried different locations and have been in budget hotels and business hotels. So far, the Renaissance takes the cake for being the best. The hotel has just been newly renovated. The lobby is impressive and the rooms are fairly large by Amsterdam standards. There's an LCD TV and in the rooms I stayed at, King size beds. The fitness centre was also just newly opened and it was quite well equipped. I stayed on 2 separate occassions for a total of 2 weeks.
reviews.title: The Best I've Stayed at in Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Now I never stayed at Renaissance before so I am not aware how it looked before the renovation. But just looking at it today, I must say it was well worth it. The fact that Centraal Station is just a 5 minute walk away is a big plus. The Jordaan and Dam Square are also nearby so plenty of choices in as far as eating out is concerned. Kalverstraat, Amsterdam's main shopping street was just a couple of roads away. Despite the central location, it was very quiet and peaceful. I imagine such was not the case when the renovation works were on full blast, but I did not encounter any such noise during my stay, so I assume most if not all of the work had been completed at the time.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but a little on the pricey side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was staying on a corporate rate of 145 Euro and breakfast was not included. Reasonable enough for the location and particularly for business travellers though admittedly expensive if you were paying from your own personal pocket. But hey, this is Amsterdam and hotels are meant to be expensive. Space comes at a premium.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast was also quite expensive ranging from around 19+ to 24+ Euros. It was buffet style but the cheaper option allowed you only to have cold cuts and bread. The most expensive option included the hot items such as bacon, eggs, sausages as well as cereals and pancakes. In the few occassions I did have breakfast, I found the food and service to be quite good. But frankly, I usually just grabbed something from Albert Heijn at Centraal Station and had my breakfast on the go. Even on corporate account, I found that it just was not value for money. There were also several other places to eat at just outside the hotel which possibly offered better value for breakfast.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is an above average Amsterdam hotel, well located (very handy for the cetral station), with reasonable room rates for what is a pretty expensive city for good hotels. The hotel facilties are good, in particular the Club Lounge where there are free drinks and snacks in the evening (beware that it gets very busy!). My room was a decent size, and well appointed. I agree with other reviewers that internet was very slow and not what you would expect in a hotel of this level. Otherwise highly recommendable.
reviews.title: Above average Amsterdam hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: For a hotel that is supposed to be good for business people, it's internet connection is TERRIBLY slow. Nice room, nice lounge, but in this age, it is unforgivable that their internet connection is so sloppy for a hotel of this level.
reviews.title: Terrible internet connection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very big hotel, with many rooms, you have sometimes to walk 10 mns to get to your room.
reviews.title: good hotel, close to amsterdam city center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i go to this hotel often for business, i appreciate the quality of service, the lounge services also. the people are friendly and will help you immediately when needed. recommeded place to visit amsterdam
reviews.title: Good Amsterdam Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed at this property as a base for pre & post cruise accommodation. We booked a king deluxe room (larger guest room) with breakfast on both stays. The rooms were of reasonable size though the bathroom on the first stay was compact whereas on the second stay it was larger. The accommodations were modern, clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Disappointing room, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Loved the location, the comfort and cleanliness. A five minute walk from central station. I was on business but if you are touring the old town this would be a difficult location to beat. Concierge was helpful with directions. Check-in and -out were efficient. Bed was comfortable and room was clean. Would recommend higher floors, although this far enough off of the heavily-touristed streets that noice was not a problem. I got a nice sub-200 EUR rate which for this quality in old twon seemed fiar, maybe cheap.
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable, surprisingly reasonable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: This hotel is in a perfect location to explore the city. Right near central station it's within a 5 minute walk. I stayed here for two nights and the rooms are all very spacious and modern. It's one of the nicest rooms I have stayed in while traveling in Europe. All parts of the city are extremely accessible outside the hotel either by walking or by grabbing the tram which was incredibly easy. The concierge can sell you a day pass in the lobby for 7 euro along with passes to any museum or attraction you might want to see. Would highly recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: Great Central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a slight problem when checking in to the hotel as they had no booking for us. Luckily I had confirmation of my booking with me so after a short wait in reception we checked in to our room. They were busy renovating the hotel when we stayed and although we got a room that had not recently been refurbished it was still great. The room was large and clean, the bed was huge and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful and breakfast was great, plenty of choice and served hot. The hotel is in a great location and very close to the town centre. There is a pub located inside of the hotel which we had a few drinks in and we thought it had a very nice atmosphere. Overall had a great trip and I would definitely go back, 5 stars from me.
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Overall a great stay. Service first class, clean and modern, much enjoyed the breakfast. Location is just the right side to be away from the seedier parts of town, while very close to station and over to Jordaan etc.
reviews.title: Great stay - just one issue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just one thing: we had a room for four, with two double beds. But though the real bed was a nice big double, the sofa bed was pretty narrow for two. Unfortunately when it comes to beds, 2 1/2 plus 1 1/2 does not equal 4!
reviews.title: Terrific stay in central Amsterdam
